abstract.text: The owner receives messages when the view is in the key window. This value specifies when the tracking area defined by an
object is active.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A left mouse-up event.
A mouse-entered event.
Informs the receiver that the mouse cursor has moved into a cursor rectangle.
Informs the receiver that the cursor has entered a tracking rectangle.
Informs the receiver that the cursor has exited a tracking rectangle.
Informs the receiver that the mouse has moved.
A region of a view that generates mouse-tracking and cursor-update events when the pointer is over that region.
The data type defined for the constants specified in the

The owner receives messages regardless of first-responder status, window status, or application status. The
message is
sent when the
option is specified along with this constant. This value specifies when the tracking area defined by an
object is active.
The owner receives messages when the application is active. This value specifies when the tracking area defined by an
object is active.
The owner receives messages when the view is in the key window. This value specifies when the tracking area defined by an
object is active.
The owner receives messages when the view is the first responder. This value specifies when the tracking area defined by an
object is active.
The first event is generated when the cursor leaves the tracking area, regardless if the cursor is inside the area when the

is added to a view.  If this option is not specified, the first event is generated when the cursor leaves the tracking area if the cursor is initially inside the area, or when the cursor enters the area if the cursor is initially outside it. Generally, you do not want to request this behavior. This value specifies a behavior of the tracking area defined by the
A tracking option that receives events when the mouse cursor enters and exits the tracking area.
The owner receives

events when the mouse cursor is dragged into the tracking area. If this option is not specified, the owner receives mouse-entered events when the mouse is moved (no buttons pressed) into the tracking area and on
events after a mouse drag.

Mouse tracking occurs only in the visible rectangle of the view—in other words, that region of the tracking rectangle that is unobscured. Otherwise, the entire tracking area is active regardless of overlapping views. The
object is automatically synchronized with changes in the view’s visible area (
) and the value returned from
is ignored. This value specifies a behavior of the tracking area defined by the
The owner of the tracking area receives
when the mouse cursor enters the area and
events when the mouse leaves the area. This value specifies a type of tracking area.
The owner of the tracking area receives
messages while the mouse cursor is within the area. This value specifies a type of tracking area.
Initializes and returns an object defining a region of a view to receive mouse-tracking events, mouse-moved events, cursor-update events, or possibly all these events.
The rectangle defining the area encompassed by the receiver.
The portion of the view that isn’t clipped by its superviews.
